body.name: TOALLIN 1080P Webcam for Windows Hello Face Login, IR Facial Recognition Camera, Windows Hello Compatible Webcam with Microphone, Computer Camera, Wide Angle View USB Webcam with Privacy Cover
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tomorrow, February 13. Order within 6 hrs 52 mins
Or fastest pickup Tomorrow, February 13. Order within 9 hrs 52 mins
features: 【Windows Hello Compatible Webcam】 Hello-One Webcam can be used as a normal computer camera, but also compatibles with Windows Hello Face. Fast facial recognition and password-free to log in your PC within few seconds. 【NOTICE】: The facial recognition feature only compatibles with the Official Windows version(Win10 or above) which has installed Windows Hello Face.
【Multi-Facial Recognition Login】Windows Hello Face Login allows you to set up one or more people's face to log in your computer.

【FHD 1080P & Wide Angle View Webcam】Hello-One built-in full hd 1080p 1/2.9" CMOS sensor, 2 Mega Pixel, can outputs clear and sharp quality video. 90° FOV ensure anyone can be visible in the meeting rooms.
【Noise-Canceling Microphone】With Noise-Reduction Algorithm, reduce background noise, automatically amplify your voice to achieve a clearer conversation.
【Built-in Privacy Cover】With the built-in privacy cover, you can be visible or invisible at any time without exit the conference or turn off the web camera.
【Customer Service】We offer 7*24-hours customer support, please send me a message via Amazon if you encounter any problems about the product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Wasnt expecting it to work so well, however, to my suprise, it does. The facial recognition, Windows Hello function, works perfectly, every time. Ive been using this for a month now. The picture quality is great. The mic sounds ok, however, had some difficulty between the sound drivers on my PC, but that is a softeare issue as I have multiple sound driver applications installed. All in all, this camera works perfectly for video calls, Windows Hello Log in (saves so much time typing in every time), and sets up very easily. The price, compared to models with the same specs/functionality, is so much cheaper. You cant go wrong here.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The webcam camera works well and was not difficult to set up. Works with Windows Hello. The user guide could be clearer (i.e., detailed and accurate). I recommend this product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for the windows hello capability a few months ago. I set it up as soon as i received it. Setup was incredibly easy, and it hasn't had any issues such as lagging or freezing. Picture appears to be good quality but my vision isn't the best, so take that for what you want. I definitwly think it was worth the purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Inexplicably died after 7 months
reviews.reviewText: Camera worked fine for 7 months, then went completely dead. Draw your own conclusions.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works with Windows Hello unlcoks
reviews.reviewText: Bought this to replace an older 1080p webcam that did not support Windows Hello facial recognition unlocking. This camera is solid and supports Windows Hello. Picture quality is very good, not the best I've seen, but excellent at this price point.Much better than using any laptop's built-in camera.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good window hello camera
reviews.reviewText: So far this has been a good hello windows camera.I have not used it as webcam yet.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars I Am Conflicted *Updated!
reviews.reviewText: ! ! Update: just weeks after purchasing, today after booting up my PC, the facial recognition feature seemed to fail because I let my facial hair grow out too long. So I used my password and logged in and attempted to improve accuracy in windows hello. This is where it got very interesting, because it wouldn’t do anything. Instead I noticed a glitch in the camera feed every half a second or so. I was already becoming concerned when I noticed that my PC started crashing, freezing and I even got blue screened a couple times (BSOD) in the days leading up to this. I wondered if that was because I used a different USB cable than the one that came with it, so I swapped it out for the one supplied, and now this. I knew it had nothing to do with the USB cable, this camera is just overpriced junk that I 100% will be returning. ! !(Old review) It is nice if all you want to do is login using Windows Hello. So far, it does that better than the USB Fingerprint reader I was using before. The fingerprint reader would fail sometimes if my skin was dry, dirty, or damaged or the scanner got dirty, dusty or oily and would still end up requiring my password/Pin after a random number of failed attempts it seems, and that was extremely annoying. That's why I got this, even though it is definitely more expensive, like 3 times more.I would even say too expensive for what it is honestly. I'm a college graduate, majored in computer science and engineering, including security, and let me tell you something! Biometrics are way overpriced! NONE OF THIS technology is new! Consumers are totally being played and ripped off for these little things while companies who can afford to buy in bulk like Samsung and Apple get them for pennies.That is why I just can't give it 5 stars, and I can't even give it 4 stars at this price because it's only 1080p, that's almost 20-year-old tech. This is 2023.. I was able to rationalize giving it 3 stars because it is plug and play. I appreciate not having to deal with searching for, downloading, and installing sketchy drivers.If it stops working, I'll update the review and take stars away (I did, see above!)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Windows 11 Hello works perfectly
reviews.reviewText: When performing a cold start, I have noticed the camera occasionally not engaging, but for all other intents and purposes, when engaged the face recognition is instant.

reviews.reviewTitle: Decent image quality, Windows Hello setup does NOT work (EDIT: it now works in 2024)
reviews.reviewText: Decent image quality, but I bought this mainly for Windows Hello login. I stay stuck at the initial setup phase, I look at the camera straight on for over two minutes and ever only see the Cancel button. I'll be requesting a refund. I should have known better than believe such a cheap webcam could actually deliver on its promises.EDIT: I didn't get a refund and kept the webcam in a drawer, tried it again in January 2024... and it now works for facial recognition. Who knows what changed between when I purchased it and now, but everything's good. One star left removed just because of the mystery.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Works with Windows Hello to log in using facial recognition 👍
Good web cam / hello ID cameraWorks well on usb A port but not usc C?Easy to set up and use under Windows 11

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: Works, face recognition even in the dark
reviews.reviewText: No more windows pin, I've saved 4 keypresses every time I log into windows, about once a week. But the webcam is great, as expected, all round great product.

The camera seems to be good value for money. The picture quality is good (far in advance of my old non-HD camera), and the mounting makes it quite secure sitting on top of my monitor; it can also be screwed into a little camera stand if you prefer, but that accessory is not included. I can confirm it works with Windows Hello for facial recognition. Just remember you need a PC that supports Trusted Platform Module (TPM} as well, my older laptop does not so no Windows face recognition is available there regardless of the camera. Lastly the camera has a sliding privacy shutter too, so all in all it does everything you could want in a reasonably priced camera.
